review: I love the concept of this, but I think I should have just bought the Amazon TV. There is constant buffering. I don't have this issue with my Apple TV. I hardly use it because it challenging to watch a show with intermittent buffering. I know now that the HDMI sticks just aren't as good quality. Also, I wasn't expecting to have to have it plugged into the wall all the time. You don't have to do this, but the buffering is so much worse if you dont. Great idea, but I won't ever buy a stick again.

review: I purchased and installed the Fire TV Stick.  I was disappointed that the description doesn't include a "What's in the box" section.  If I had known there is a USB cable included, I wouldn't have purchased one separately.  I was also surprised to find that the device requires an outlet for power -- it can't be simple connected to a USB port on my TV.  It's ability to stream WiFi is so-so.  I should probably purchased the Fire TV device that can use a wired connection.
